title: 70s Sans Serifs
content:
I found these in an archive at an old school. I believe they are from the 70s though I could be mistaken. One of the faces looks similar to Futura and Century Gothic and the other I'm not sure may be closer to an Optima style.

Can anyone figure these out?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [WBC-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424023258/http:/typophile.com/files/WBC-1.jpg) | 43.58 KB |
| [WBC-2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424023258/http:/typophile.com/files/WBC-2.jpg) | 18.15 KB |
author: tylor.reimer

comments.content:
Try posting your request in the new type ID forum:  
 [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424023258/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")  
Don
Oh didn't see there was a new one. Thanks!

The first is [Vogue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424023258/http:/fontsinuse.com/typefaces/10456/vogue). It was used in the 1930s–50s. Not so much in the ’70s as it probably didn’t make the jump from metal to film.
Thanks Stephen! Now to see if I can find what the second is. I may have to just redraw it for my purposes if there is no typeface like it.
